pageDescription: Decision tree for practitioners, researchers, and Studio inquiries.

hero.heading: Start here
hero.description: Use this decision tree to choose your first step in the Institute.
hero.quickNote: If you are deciding between research or implementation, follow the paths below.
hero.quickSummary: This page routes you to patterns, research, and Studio support without extra layers.
deliverables: A clear path based on your role and intent.
Direct links to core patterns or research anchors.
A fast handoff to the Studio when you need implementation support.

panel.title: How to use this page
panel.description: Pick the path that matches your role. Each link lands on a stable, shareable resource.

actions.label: View accountability escalation pattern
actions.ariaLabel: Open the appeal paths mechanism pattern

decisionGuide.title: Choose your path
decisionGuide.description: Pick the path that matches what you need right now.

prompts.question: I'm a practitioner implementing Ethotechnics
prompts.answer: Start with the Burden Modeler and the accountability escalation pattern.
prompts.label: Start with Burden Modeler

prompts.question: I'm a researcher studying care infrastructure
prompts.answer: Start with the theoretical foundations and current research papers.
prompts.label: Open research

prompts.question: I'm evaluating hiring Ethotechnics Studio
prompts.answer: Route directly to Studio services for implementation support.
prompts.label: Visit Studio services

prompts.question: I want to stay updated
prompts.answer: Subscribe to receive research and practice updates.
prompts.label: Subscribe to updates

routes.title: Pick the entry point that matches your role.
routes.description: Each path routes you to the right patterns, research, or Studio handoff.

cards.title: I'm a practitioner implementing Ethotechnics
cards.description: Start with the Burden Modeler and accountability escalation pattern to ground your work.
cards.bestFor: Best for: delivery teams and practitioners working on live systems.
cards.recommendedNote: Recommended first step for implementation work.

cards.title: I'm a researcher studying care infrastructure
cards.description: Begin with the core axioms and research publications for citation-ready theory.
cards.bestFor: Best for: scholars, researchers, and educators.

cards.title: I'm evaluating hiring Ethotechnics Studio
cards.description: Route directly to the Studio for implementation support and partnership intake.
cards.bestFor: Best for: teams seeking facilitation or delivery support.

cards.title: I want to stay updated
cards.description: Subscribe for research updates and practice notes.
cards.bestFor: Best for: staying in the loop without a live project.

artifacts.title: See what you can take with you.
artifacts.description: Diagnostics and playbooks export to PDFs you can share with leadership, regulators, or delivery partners.

previews.title: Diagnostic readout
previews.description: Summarizes the scenario, readiness score, and recommendations in a shareable format.
previews.label: Download diagnostic sample (PDF)
previews.note: Formatted for quick executive sharing with glossary references.

previews.title: Playbook excerpt
previews.description: A compact PDF pull from the mechanisms catalog that pairs prompts, checklists, and glossary links for reuse.
previews.label: Download playbook sample (PDF)
previews.note: Use it to brief a partner before running a diagnostic together.

quickStart.title: Role-specific guides to jumpstart your work.
quickStart.description: Choose the role that matches your responsibilities to open the most relevant references.

framing.title: What this page is and is not.
framing.description: Use this as a routing map; every link lands on a stable resource.
isList: A decision tree for practitioners, researchers, and Studio inquiries.
A shortcut to the most cited patterns and research anchors.
A clear boundary between open resources and paid implementation support.
isNotList: A comprehensive guide to every Institute resource.
A gated or invite-only experience; every link is public.

studio.title: When to bring in the Studio.
studio.description: The Institute stays open and self-serve. The Studio steps in for implementation.
bullets: Use the Studio when you need facilitation, training, or co-delivery.
Escalate from any pattern or diagnostic when risk or ambiguity surfaces.
Studio engagements feed learnings back into public Institute resources.
studio.ctaAriaLabel: Open Ethotechnics Studio services in a new tab

footerCta.title: Subscribe for research and practice updates.
footerCta.description: Choose the update stream that matches your work and stay informed.
